0: Prepare and process import and export documentation according to customs regulations, laws, or procedures.
Clear goods through customs and to their destinations for clients.
Pay, or arrange for payment of, taxes and duties on shipments.
Calculate duty and tariff payments owed on shipments.
Request or compile necessary import documentation, such as customs invoices, certificates of origin, and cargo-control documents.
Classify goods according to tariff coding system.
Stay abreast of changes in import or export laws or regulations by reading current literature, attending meetings or conferences, or conferring with colleagues.
Sign documents on behalf of clients, using powers of attorney.
Advise customers on import and export restrictions, tariff systems, insurance requirements, quotas, or other customs-related matters.
Post bonds for the products being imported or assist clients in obtaining bonds.
Quote duty and tax rates on goods to be imported, based on federal tariffs and excise taxes.
Arrange for transportation, warehousing, or product distribution of imported or exported products.
Monitor or trace the location of goods.
Confer with officials in various agencies to facilitate clearance of goods through customs and quarantine.
Inform importers and exporters of steps to reduce duties and taxes.
Obtain line releases for frequent shippers of low-risk commodities, high-volume entries, or multiple-container loads.
Provide advice on transportation options, types of carriers, or shipping routes.
Contract with freight forwarders for destination services.
Apply for tariff concessions or for duty drawbacks and other refunds.
Insure cargo against loss, damage, or pilferage.
Prepare papers for shippers to appeal duty charges.
1: Analyze training needs to develop new training programs or modify and improve existing programs.
Evaluate instructor performance and the effectiveness of training programs, providing recommendations for improvement.

Plan, develop, and provide training and staff development programs, using knowledge of the effectiveness of methods such as classroom training, demonstrations, on-the-job training, meetings, conferences, and workshops.
Confer with management and conduct surveys to identify training needs based on projected production processes, changes, and other factors.
Conduct orientation sessions and arrange on-the-job training for new hires.
Train instructors and supervisors in techniques and skills for training and dealing with employees.
Develop and organize training manuals, multimedia visual aids, and other educational materials.
Prepare training budget for department or organization.
Develop testing and evaluation procedures.
Conduct or arrange for ongoing technical training and personal development classes for staff members.
Review and evaluate training and apprenticeship programs for compliance with government standards.
2: Monitor and record food temperatures to ensure food safety.
Cook foodstuffs according to menus, special dietary or nutritional restrictions, or numbers of portions to be served.
Rotate and store food supplies.
Wash pots, pans, dishes, utensils, or other cooking equipment.
Apportion and serve food to facility residents, employees, or patrons.
Clean and inspect galley equipment, kitchen appliances, and work areas to ensure cleanliness and functional operation.
Clean, cut, and cook meat, fish, or poultry.
Direct activities of one or more workers who assist in preparing and serving meals.
Train new employees.
Take inventory of supplies and equipment.
Requisition food supplies, kitchen equipment, and appliances, based on estimates of future needs.
Bake breads, rolls, or other pastries.

0: Verify importer compliance with customs regulations and documentation.
Prepare and submit accurate Harmonized System (HS) code classifications for exported goods.
Facilitate the clearance process for shipments by communicating with airlines, shipping lines, and freight forwarders.
Conduct thorough risk assessments to identify potential security threats and implement mitigation strategies.
Maintain up-to-date knowledge of changing customs regulations, tariffs, and trade policies.
Coordinate with warehouses and distribution centers to ensure seamless inventory management.
Process and resolve customer complaints regarding customs clearance issues or delays.
Prepare and submit customs declaration forms (CN23/CF24) accurately and on time.
Conduct audits to ensure importer compliance with relevant regulations and guidelines.
Negotiate with carriers and freight forwarders to secure competitive rates for shipments.
Monitor shipment tracking and status updates in real-time to anticipate potential delays or issues.
Develop and implement customs brokerages' quality control procedures to maintain high standards.
Foster collaborative relationships with government agencies, shipping lines, and other stakeholders.
Provide training and support to importer customers on customs regulations and compliance requirements.
Stay current with industry developments, best practices, and emerging trends in customs brokerage services.
Manage and track shipment insurance claims to ensure timely resolution of losses or damages.
Maintain accurate records of customer interactions, shipments, and documentation.
Collaborate with importers to resolve cargo release issues and expedite delivery schedules.
Develop customized solutions for unique importer needs, such as streamlined customs procedures.
Ensure compliance with industry security standards, including data encryption and access controls.
Verify importer compliance with safety regulations (e.g., OSHA) when managing hazardous materials shipments.
1: Designing comprehensive training programs to enhance employee skills and knowledge.
Evaluating the effectiveness of existing training initiatives and identifying areas for improvement.
Developing a budget and scheduling plan for corporate training sessions.
Coordinating with internal stakeholders to align training programs with organizational goals.
Creating engaging visual aids, presentations, and handouts for trainees.
Providing coaching and mentoring support to new hires and underperforming employees.
Collaborating with subject matter experts to create accurate and up-to-date training content.
Assessing the needs of various employee groups and tailoring training programs accordingly.
Implementing new technology or tools to enhance online learning experiences.
Conducting needs assessments and gap analyses to inform training program development.
Leading a team of trainers and facilitators to deliver corporate training sessions effectively.
2: Prepare and cook meals according to recipes and dietary restrictions in a timely and efficient manner.
Maintain a clean and sanitized kitchen environment, adhering to health and safety standards.
Manage inventory of ingredients and supplies, ordering replacements as needed.
Supervise and train junior staff members on cooking techniques and kitchen procedures.
Coordinate with event planners to create customized menus for special occasions.
Develop and implement new recipes and menu items, considering nutritional value and flavor profile.
Monitor food quality and safety, identifying areas for improvement and implementing corrective actions.
Collaborate with nutritionists to design healthy and balanced menus for institutional clients.
Implement energy-efficient practices in the kitchen, reducing waste and conserving resources.
Develop and maintain relationships with suppliers and vendors, negotiating contracts and ensuring fair prices.
Create visually appealing presentations of dishes, garnishing and plating according to presentation guidelines.
Conduct regular quality control checks on food preparation and service, ensuring consistency and excellence.
